DOCNAME: CASE OF NADULISNEAC ION v. MOLDOVA
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . Following the applicant 's unlawful detention for DATE and then his acquittal , on an unspecified date in DATE he brought an action against ORG , seeking compensation for wrongful prosecution .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ruled in favour of the applicant and ordered the defendant to pay him CARDINAL Moldovan lei ( MDL ) ( the equivalent of MONEY ( ORG ) at the time ) . On DATE ORG issued an enforcement warrant . The judgment was not appealed against and after DATE it became final and enforceable .
CARDINAL . On DATE a Bailiff of the Edineţ District sent the enforcement warrant to a Bailiff of LOC .
CARDINAL . In DATE , after the case had been communicated to the Government , the judgment was enforced .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law was set out in GPE v. GPE ( no . MONEY , ECHR CARDINALIII ( extracts ) ) and PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL ) ( no . FAC , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , DATE ) .
CARDINAL . The Civil Code of DATE reads as follows :

“ ( CARDINAL ) Default interest is payable for delayed execution of pecuniary obligations . Default interest shall be PERCENT above the interest rate provided for in LAW [ ORG refinancing interest rate ] unless the law or the contract provides otherwise . Proof that less damage has been incurred shall be admissible .

( CARDINAL ) NORP In non consumer - related situations default interest shall be PERCENT above the interest rate provided for in LAW unless the law or the contract provides otherwise . Proof that less damage has been incurred shall be inadmissible . ”
